thread.title: Datadog Unveils Plans for Data Center in Australia | DDOG Stock News
thread.title_full: Datadog Unveils Plans for Data Center in Australia | DDOG Stock News

author: StockTitan
title: Datadog Unveils Plans for Data Center in Australia | DDOG Stock News
text:
Datadog Unveils Plans for Data Center in Australia
Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) has announced plans to establish its first Australian data center, built on AWS infrastructure. This strategic expansion adds to Datadog's existing data centers in North America, Asia, Europe, and AWS GovCloud.
The new facility, scheduled to open mid-2025, will provide sovereign data storage and processing capabilities to help customers meet local privacy and security requirements. The expansion follows Datadog's recent opening of a Melbourne office and team growth across Sydney and Auckland.
Key customers have endorsed the platform's capabilities, with Flight Centre Corporate's ANZ CTO highlighting Datadog's ability to unite their technology ecosystem, while SEEK's Group Executive of Technology praised the platform's proactive issue resolution capabilities. The data center will particularly benefit businesses in regulated sectors like healthcare and financial services that require local data hosting.
Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) ha annunciato piani per stabilire il suo primo centro dati in Australia, costruito su infrastruttura AWS. Questa espansione strategica si aggiunge ai centri dati esistenti di Datadog in Nord America, Asia, Europa e AWS GovCloud.
La nuova struttura, prevista per l'apertura a metà 2025, fornirà capacità di archiviazione e elaborazione dei dati sovrani per aiutare i clienti a soddisfare i requisiti locali di privacy e sicurezza. L'espansione segue l'apertura recente di un ufficio a Melbourne e la crescita del team a Sydney e Auckland.
I clienti chiave hanno sostenuto le capacità della piattaforma, con il CTO di Flight Centre Corporate per l'ANZ che ha evidenziato la capacità di Datadog di unire il loro ecosistema tecnologico, mentre l'Esecutivo di Gruppo di Tecnologia di SEEK ha lodato le capacità proattive di risoluzione dei problemi della piattaforma. Il centro dati beneficerà particolarmente le aziende in settori regolamentati come la sanità e i servizi finanziari che richiedono hosting locale dei dati.
Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) ha anunciado planes para establecer su primer centro de datos en Australia, construido sobre la infraestructura de AWS. Esta expansión estratégica se suma a los centros de datos existentes de Datadog en América del Norte, Asia, Europa y AWS GovCloud.
La nueva instalación, programada para abrir a mediados de 2025, proporcionará capacidades de almacenamiento y procesamiento de datos soberanos para ayudar a los clientes a cumplir con los requisitos locales de privacidad y seguridad. La expansión sigue a la reciente apertura de una oficina en Melbourne y al crecimiento del equipo en Sídney y Auckland.
Clientes clave han respaldado las capacidades de la plataforma, con el CTO de Flight Centre Corporate en ANZ destacando la capacidad de Datadog para unir su ecosistema tecnológico, mientras que el Ejecutivo de Grupo de Tecnología de SEEK elogió las capacidades proactivas de resolución de problemas de la plataforma. El centro de datos beneficiará especialmente a las empresas en sectores regulados como la salud y los servicios financieros que requieren alojamiento local de datos.
Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG)는 AWS 인프라를 기반으로 한 호주 첫 데이터 센터를 설립할 계획을 발표했습니다. 이 전략적 확장은 북미, 아시아, 유럽 및 AWS GovCloud에 있는 Datadog의 기존 데이터 센터에 추가됩니다.
2025년 중반에 개소할 예정인 이 새로운 시설은 주권 데이터 저장 및 처리 능력을 제공하여 고객이 현지의 개인 정보 보호 및 보안 요구 사항을 충족할 수 있도록 도와줍니다. 이번 확장은 멜버른 사무소의 최근 개설과 시드니 및 오클랜드에서의 팀 성장에 따른 것입니다.
주요 고객들은 플랫폼의 능력을 지지했으며, Flight Centre Corporate의 ANZ CTO는 Datadog이 그들의 기술 생태계를 통합할 수 있는 능력을 강조했습니다. SEEK의 기술 그룹 임원은 플랫폼의 능동적인 문제 해결 능력을 칭찬했습니다. 데이터 센터는 특히 의료 및 금융 서비스와 같은 규제된 분야의 기업들에 혜택을 줄 것입니다.
Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) a annoncé des projets pour établir son premier centre de données australien, construit sur l'infrastructure AWS. Cette expansion stratégique s'ajoute aux centres de données existants de Datadog en Amérique du Nord, en Asie, en Europe et sur AWS GovCloud.
La nouvelle installation, prévue pour ouvrir à la mi-2025, fournira des capacités de stockage et de traitement des données souveraines pour aider les clients à répondre aux exigences locales en matière de confidentialité et de sécurité. L'expansion fait suite à l'ouverture récente d'un bureau à Melbourne et à la croissance de l'équipe à Sydney et à Auckland.
Des clients clés ont soutenu les capacités de la plateforme, le CTO de Flight Centre Corporate pour l'ANZ soulignant la capacité de Datadog à unir leur écosystème technologique, tandis que l'exécutif de groupe de technologie de SEEK a loué les capacités proactives de résolution des problèmes de la plateforme. Le centre de données bénéficiera particulièrement aux entreprises dans des secteurs réglementés tels que la santé et les services financiers qui nécessitent un hébergement local des données.
Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) hat Pläne angekündigt, sein erstes australisches Rechenzentrum auf AWS-Infrastruktur zu errichten. Diese strategische Expansion ergänzt die bestehenden Rechenzentren von Datadog in Nordamerika, Asien, Europa und AWS GovCloud.
Die neue Einrichtung, die Mitte 2025 eröffnet werden soll, wird staatliche Datenlagerung und Verarbeitungskapazitäten bereitstellen, um Kunden dabei zu helfen, lokale Datenschutz- und Sicherheitsanforderungen zu erfüllen. Die Expansion folgt der kürzlichen Eröffnung eines Büros in Melbourne und dem Wachstum des Teams in Sydney und Auckland.
Wichtige Kunden haben die Fähigkeiten der Plattform unterstützt, wobei der CTO von Flight Centre Corporate für ANZ die Fähigkeit von Datadog hervorhob, ihr Technologie-Ökosystem zu vereinen, während der Group Executive of Technology von SEEK die proaktiven Problemlösungsfähigkeiten der Plattform lobte. Das Rechenzentrum wird insbesondere Unternehmen in regulierten Sektoren wie dem Gesundheitswesen und den Finanzdienstleistungen zugutekommen, die lokale Datenhosting benötigen.
- Geographic expansion into Australian market with new data center
- Growing presence in ANZ region with new Melbourne office
- Strategic positioning to serve regulated industries requiring local data hosting
- Endorsements from major enterprise customers (Flight Centre, SEEK)
- None.
Insights
Datadog's planned Australian data center represents a strategic expansion of their global infrastructure footprint that could drive incremental revenue growth in the Asia-Pacific region. This investment directly addresses data sovereignty requirements in Australia, removing a potential barrier to adoption for enterprises in highly regulated sectors.
The timing aligns with increasing regulatory pressure worldwide regarding data localization, positioning Datadog to capture market share from competitors lacking local processing capabilities. For context, Australia's privacy framework includes strict data sovereignty requirements, particularly for healthcare, financial services, and government entities.
The endorsements from Flight Centre and SEEK - two major Australian enterprises - signal existing traction in the market. The expansion follows Datadog's recent Melbourne office opening, indicating a coordinated go-to-market strategy rather than just isolated infrastructure investment.
While financial details and projected ROI weren't disclosed, this move should enhance Datadog's competitive position against both global monitoring platforms and local alternatives. By addressing regulatory compliance needs, Datadog is targeting the premium enterprise segment where deals typically carry higher average contract values and better retention rates.
Datadog's decision to build their Australian data center on AWS rather than establishing their own physical infrastructure reflects a pragmatic approach to balancing capital efficiency with market responsiveness. This deployment model allows faster time-to-market while maintaining technical consistency with their existing regional deployments.
The announcement specifically highlights availability of their complete product portfolio in the new region - significant because maintaining feature parity across geographically distributed environments presents technical challenges that smaller competitors often struggle with. Datadog's ability to offer their full stack locally gives them an edge in competitive evaluations.
This Australian data center addresses the technical latency issues that previously impacted ANZ customers, particularly for real-time monitoring use cases. Lower latency improves the effectiveness of Datadog's anomaly detection capabilities, enhancing value for customers running mission-critical workloads.
From a technical perspective, this expansion strengthens Datadog's disaster recovery capabilities and provides geographic redundancy - increasingly important selling points as enterprises shift from on-premises monitoring to cloud-based observability platforms. The move also positions Datadog to better support customers adopting multi-cloud strategies that include regional Australian cloud services.
Local data center to create sovereign data storage and processing capacity for Datadog's customers and partners, helping meet local privacy and security requirements and preferences
New York, New York--(Newsfile Corp. - April 2, 2025) - Datadog, Inc. (NASDAQ: DDOG), the monitoring and security platform for cloud applications, today announced plans for a new data center to be located in Australia. The data center instance, which will be built on AWS, will be Datadog's first in Australia and adds to existing locations in North America, Asia, Europe and AWS GovCloud.
The Australian data center will store and process data locally, creating sovereign capacity to help Datadog's customers meet local privacy and security requirements and preferences. All existing Datadog products will be available with the new data center.
"As the ANZ Chief Technology Officer at Flight Centre Corporate, I am watching Datadog unite our entire technology ecosystem into a single pane of glass—transforming us from reactive to proactive and elevating outcomes for every level of the business," said Grant Currey, Chief Technology Officer, Corporate ANZ at Flight Centre Travel Group.
"With Datadog's end-to-end observability, we can detect and address service quality across multiple business units. Ensuring we are proactively resolving issues before they become business critical for us," said Lisa Tobin, Group Executive, Technology at SEEK.
"We continue to invest in Australia and New Zealand, with the recent opening of our Melbourne office and the expansion of our teams there, as well as in Sydney and Auckland," said Yanbing Li, Chief Product Officer at Datadog. "Australian companies are innovating rapidly and rely on Datadog to support their continued cloud investments, digital transformations and AI projects. For businesses in highly regulated industries like healthcare and financial services, hosting data locally is critical—a need we're addressing with this new data center."
The data center is expected to open in the middle of this year.
About Datadog
Datadog is the observability and security platform for cloud applications. Our SaaS platform integrates and automates infrastructure monitoring, application performance monitoring, log management, user experience monitoring, cloud security and many other capabilities to provide unified, real-time observability and security for our customers' entire technology stack. Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes and across a wide range of industries to enable digital transformation and cloud migration, drive collaboration among development, operations, security and business teams, accelerate time to market for applications, reduce time to problem resolution, secure applications and infrastructure, understand user behavior and track key business metrics.
Forward-Looking Statements
This press release may include certain "forward-looking statements" within the meaning of Section 27A of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, or the Securities Act, and Section 21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended including statements on the benefits of new products and features. These forward-looking statements reflect our current views about our plans, intentions, expectations, strategies and prospects, which are based on the information currently available to us and on assumptions we have made. Actual results may differ materially from those described in the forward-looking statements and are subject to a variety of assumptions, uncertainties, risks and factors that are beyond our control, including those risks detailed under the caption "Risk Factors" and elsewhere in our Securities and Exchange Commission filings and reports, including the Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on February 20, 2025, as well as future filings and reports by us. Except as required by law, we undertake no duty or obligation to update any forward-looking statements contained in this release as a result of new information, future events, changes in expectations or otherwise.
Contact
Dan Haggertypress@datadoghq.com
To view the source version of this press release, please visit https://www.newsfilecorp.com/release/246941
